HOLYBALLS AHAHAHAH I PLAYED A GAME WITH YOU BEFORE I WAS RENGAR ADC AHAHHAAHAHHA NO WAY I CAN'T BELIEVE I FOUND YOUR NAME HERE WE MEET AGAIN.
:DDD

I'm still trying to get my mind back into my real life after being lost in this glorious piece of mastery. This story unfolds in a way that makes sense but doesn't, continues to pick up speed and invites the reader to ask all along the way, What the hell was Kindred playing at? What don't I know? How can this possibly be resolved? How far will Maga go now?...

I enjoyed the start of this story much more then the finish. Experiencing the main character while she unearthed the mystery was pretty interesting. The whole second half where she meets Kindred was pretty intense(i hyperventilated), the end was pretty... meh. As for the detail incorporated, pretty amazeballs.

Here... Have my money rito... 

Also, you better make this an animation... or else {{champion:39}}
I'd probably say that Kindred was doing that to get Magga to act as an educator of sorts, of what it's like to meet them.
Reminds me of the book The Name of the Wind.
THAT WAS REALLY INTENSE! {{champion:45}}
Is that a short joke?
<3 {{champion:45}}

i don't understand the real location of this champion
They are from the entireity of Runeterra. They don't belong to any one faction. Sorta like Aatrox and Bard.
Gods, am i right?

Yes, sort of. They are more like manifestations of Aspects, like (excuse my WoW reference) Ragnaros was only a manifestation in Blackrock Mountain, his true form was in another dimension, in this case, the firelands. Kindred is a manifestation of the Aspect of Death. Returning to WoW, their equivalent would be Deathwing. Now that Xerath is 'Ascended', he is a manifestation of the Aspect of Magic (Malygos). I'll stop the WoW references here.
tl;dr : they are sort of gods but sort of not gods, something in between.
